author: ryanleeschneider
content: With 7702 coming in Pectra have their been any discussions about how `eth_getTransactionCount` will behave?  If a 7702 tx bumps the nonce of account A do we expect `eth_getTransactionCount(A, latest)` to return the bumped nonce?

author: lightclient
content: it would just return the nonce of the account

author: ryanleeschneider
content:
Should we update the description in execution-apis to better match the reality? Currently it says:

> Returns the number of transactions sent from an address.

https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/eth/state.yaml#L36

My guess is all the ELs already just lookup the nonce rather than tracking an actual tx count, so maybe say something like:

> Returns the nonce of the account.  NOTE: The name getTransactionCount reflects the historical fact that before the Pectra fork nonce and sent transaction count were the same.

We can iterate on the wording, but if that sounds like a reasonable approach let me know and I'll open a PR.

author: lightclient
content: yeah i think we should update the description to something along the lines of what youâ€™re saying
